website_summaries.verdict: This was developed with great attention to details.
pros: This is a versatile fishing pontoon that is stable enough for moderate river use
There's also plenty of storage room
With 20 pockets and two insulated drink holders, it meets practical needs
cons: If over-inflated, there's potential for issues with the valves, though that's to be expected

customer_reviews.title: Very durable,well built and light weight,but you can’t be afraid to get feet wet.
customer_reviews.text: We are in our 70s and had to give up kayaking rivers so these are the alternative. We’ve been out several times and they are perfect for us. We have used them on both lakes and class ll rivers,they are very, very stable and maneuverable ,added trolling motors and use kayak paddles instead of oars. Easy assembly and breakdown.Taking them East this year to paddle 10 more states in our quest to paddle all 50 before we are too old and these boats We believe will get us there.
customer_reviews.author: william taylor

customer_reviews.title: fantastic boat
customer_reviews.text: Great boat, very easy to assemble and very sturdy on the water. Several of my friends have other versions of inflatable pontoons and all are envious of this one and a few have even talked of upgrading to this model. Have had it on 2 rivers and 3 lakes and it functions perfectly even in the rapids.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Moody

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Nice way to get on  the water inexpensively
customer_reviews.text: Floats great, nice fishing platform, plenty of storage, comfortable. Easier than my Kayak to get into. Motor mount gets an electric trolling motor on board, but reaching the motor is a literal pain and steering the boat with the motor on is really bad. I am now trying to mount the motor in the front for easier access and improved steering. All things considered, much less expensive than a fishing Kayak and I would make the same purchase decision because of the value. Please also note that manuverability would likely be acceptable with the provided oars. The craft does get blown around a not insignificant amount.
customer_reviews.author: Open to new things

customer_reviews.title: Far exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: One of the best made products I have purchased in a long time. Extremely detailed clear instructions for assembly. All parts fit together easily. Whoever designed this really knew what they were doing. When inflating, remember a Boston valve will allow air to enter the chamber even though it appears to be closed. Very easy to row and works well with electric trolling motor.
customer_reviews.author: Flaboy35

customer_reviews.title: Don't hesitate, this is a winner
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this purchase. It is a rock-solid product and I expect it to last for years. As another reviewer noted, it's way too easy to add a swivel seat not to do it. Use a standard swivel, cut off the bolts on the seat to fit and attach the seat with the wingnuts. Then as another reviewer said use carriage bolts to attach the assembly to the rails and knurled knobs to make everything easily adjustable. I used 1 1/2" 1/4" carriage bolts and these knobs:
customer_reviews.author: scrapper

customer_reviews.title: This is a remarkable boat
customer_reviews.text: As a 76 year old woman and a gal who loves fishing, this is my dream boat. A little 5 horse electric motor, night crawlers, power bait and loads of storage for everything else that I might want to eat or use, I am all set. This pontoon is made very, very well and most likely will last for as many years as I have left. WooHoo, this is wonderful. NOTE: Hard to find pressure gauge UNTIL NOW. It is Air Pressure Gauge for Inflatable Boat Raft. PN: SW0006600074 BS Air Gauge here on Amazon. Would love to see Classic Accessories carry this for their pontoon customers.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Girl

customer_reviews.title: Super stable for a huge guy
customer_reviews.text: Brought this guy to Mosquito Lagoon (saltwater) for a week. Most comfortable thing I've ever fished out of. I'm a massive guy: 6'6" and 300 pounds, and I never worried about stability. It's pretty tough for going any kind of distance because it pivots with every stroke, but fantastic for short distances. If you're gonna go any distance, I'd use a trolling motor. This thing is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Rick C. Annis

customer_reviews.title: Paid for the XT got the Basic
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful here! My wife bought me the XT for Father's day! Such a wonderful gift. She paid for the XT over 500 dollars and now as I'm putting it together, California summers are not made for fishing especially for a US Army Vet who is on lots of meds that say "No Sun", for the fall months to come i notice its not the XT and past the return time. This pontoon boat is 330ish dollars not over 500 dollars. So just be careful if you order it. Make sure you get the right one because I sure didn't.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: This pontoon Boat, Classic Accessories
customer_reviews.text: My husband had it put together in no time and He uses it to trout fish, He has a kayak but its a little wobbly. He says this is soooo much better. We will need a receipt for this since it has to be registered here in Nevada, They can't do that without a receipt to see if we had to pay taxes on it. I hope we can get a receipt mailed to us
customer_reviews.author: Sherry E. Woodside

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with the rod holder.
customer_reviews.text: This boat is probably the best purchase I have ever made on amazon. Classic Accessories customer service is one of the most awesome customer service experiences I have ever had, even when the problem was my own fault. The rod holder is made for a fly rod not a spinning rod, so when you are rowing you have to potential to knock the rod out of the holder.
customer_reviews.author: anna myers

customer_reviews.title: I cannot over-recommend this thing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot fully express my complete satisfaction with this product. It is also a head turner. I have yet to go somewhere where I was not stopped and told that my little boat is the coolest thing they've ever seen. My brother and I both purchased one of these. We can fit both of our boats in the trunk of my car, assemble on site, inflate, clamp on a battery and trolling motor and launch into the water within 15 minutes. There is also a community of YouTubers that share their modifications. I have yet to add any modifications to my boat.
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Use an air gauge !
customer_reviews.text: After using twice I like the boat. However,, for my build the Oar locks are two far back on the frame. And the oar stop. on one side comes loose. If you tighten the bolts to much the bolts just pull thru the rubber stops. Will also up-grade the Chair. Boat floats great when pumped up to specs. Must use a gauge! At 2.25 lbs the toons sound like a bell,,,,cool.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Poe

customer_reviews.title: Update:  We phoned the manufacturer and have all needed info.  They were great!
customer_reviews.text: We put a motor on this product and now seeking a title (required to use in public waters in our state). To get the title they need the date of issuance, invoice number, Haull ID, year, make model, haul material, propulsions, address of dealer/distributor , name/city/state of manufacturer/ issuing MSO or MCO. Sig. of agent for manufacturer. Oh my. How do we go about getting all this information to proceed? Otherwise, we are happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ann Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Just a great boat.
customer_reviews.text: I love my new pontoon boat...it's just great...especially for a senior citizen...very stable and easy to maneuver. I installed a "Cordless Drill" motor and a "Bullnose Rudder" on mine so I can just relax and go wherever I think the fish are. I still keep the oars on the boat just in case...but don't use them much. I've built a special "Rack" for the back of my pickup to roll the boat into and out of the bed...so I don't need to do much "lifting".
customer_reviews.author: Ol' Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great little pontoon fishing boat.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for fishing! Rows super easy. I read reviews that the anchor system was junk, but mine has worked perfect! I did substitute the bag for a 8 pound sledgehammer head. Only downfall is I wished it came with a couple more rod holders and make the back rack about 4 inches wider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the trouble rowing this thing
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would try this since my kayak blows around and hard to fish with. The unit comes apart nicely and easily fit in my Subaru Forester. Major pain paddling around is my issue. The anchor did keep me in place but I still wish I didn’t buy it. Kayak is looking good now though.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Paradis

customer_reviews.title: All is great, but didn't include air compressor adaptor
customer_reviews.text: Great little boat. Bought two of them. Was a little confused with some of the instructions, but overall was very easy to put together in less than an hour. One big recommendation is that they include an air compressor adaptor. It would not be costly to include, and caused me to have to make my own. If that was included, it would be 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dclev

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: For the money I have not seen a better boat out there. Well made with features found on upper end boats. Motor mount is difficult to use in the rear position. I have relocated the mount to the front while leaving the battery on the rear deck. The front mount gives much better maneuverability and splitting the weight of motor and battery provides much better trim.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Top quality item
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a top quality item. My husband has had it out 3 times so far and we just barely got it. He has other friends that have a pontoon boat, but the quality is not near what this one is. I strongly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Happy Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great on the water!
customer_reviews.text: Makes me wonder why I didnt buy one years ago! Opens up the entire reservoir for a day of fishing without having to hike around. After adding a few mods it's great. Got to have a great pump for this.
customer_reviews.author: LAEliazar

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Sailing
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, strong construction, easy assembly, anyone who can not put this together should be hit with a tack hammer in the head!! Instructions were excellent although in somewhat pigeon English of course it came from China!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Had this boat for 5 years now. Made 1 mod allowing rotating seat. Awesome boat, very comfort to be on all day. 40lb trollihg motor with 85AH battery allows at least 12 mile trips.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Jon Pon Jovi
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty sweet with some modifications, at $432 its well worth buying. Build a deck for standing, mounted the battery to the seat rails and installed a new seat with post. I also replaced the pins with 1/4 stainless steel bolts and wing nuts, used this on the Delaware river down rapids, handled great.
customer_reviews.author: nicholasgiovinco

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: Really happy with my purchase makes for a great fishing rig as long as there is little to no wind only compliant is after 6 uses and 3 months rust is already showing on the welds on the frame
customer_reviews.author: Fredericke Leeper

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Boat
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this kayak for use by anyone looking to get on the water right away without paying a whole bunch of money for a boat. This is a very nice boat, well built. Easy to assemble, even without the best of instructions. Easy to take down and set up, can fit in the trunk of a car when taken down. Light weight, but the Classic (not XT or XS) does not come with a wheel, can order one however. Very comfortable for fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Frederica M. Spotser

customer_reviews.title: What a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: $299 for this pontoon is an extraordinary deal. The valve takes some getting used to; you must be quick to turn the valve off after you fill a pontoon with air. The features are great. There are better equipped pontoons but this one is easy transported and not that hard to lift. Oh, and now the price is $279. Wow. You find anything close for that money .
customer_reviews.author: DP@Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Read the owners manual!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble works very well & does exactly what I wanted. Clean efficient design w good storage. Should probably come w a swivel seat & pump but I understand that it doesn’t to maintain the price point. Very comfortable & I have really had great fun using it!
customer_reviews.author: dawgfather123

customer_reviews.title: outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this inflatable two months ago it has been nothing but pleasure. I have a trolling motor on the back, and it pushes me easily across the lake. A real pleasure to fish from. Had problems registering in AZ, but Amazon employee's went above and beyond to help me out, can't say enough about how nice and helpful they were.
customer_reviews.author: cowboyaz

customer_reviews.title: Pontoon fun
customer_reviews.text: Have had a great time with my pontoon, bought a trolling motor for fishing close to shore
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Come Here fishy fishy
customer_reviews.text: Best thing i ever bought. Almost every week i take it out. So relaxing and easy to maneuver. To top it off the day i decided to buy it after shopping around it went on sale. Bought a trolling motor for it also. Would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: michael dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Amazing fishing boat.
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING BOAT! We purchased this boat for our disabled son who loves to fish. We attached an electric trolling motor. FREEDOM! WITHOUT WORRY!
customer_reviews.author: Paul bedard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Base Line to Modify to Fit Your Need
customer_reviews.text: Yes, there will be some mod's, but they're all different for each user. Great base line. Added trolling, swivel seat and rod options. Took some time, but now a perfect river/still boat.
customer_reviews.author: KK's Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great boat, could use more places for caribiner clips.
customer_reviews.text: I noticed other boats in the group I went with had well placed loops for caribiners. It would have made this boat perfect. If I tried to clip items to the zipper pulls, the angle caused the zippers to open.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who had knee surgery and couldn't get his knee wet. Worked out perfect. He was able to get on the lake and fish. He has really enjoyed using this boat.
customer_reviews.author: Millicent Hobirk

customer_reviews.title: Colorado Boat
customer_reviews.text: What can I say other than this is one of the best gifts I ever bought my husband! He loves this little boat and it fits right in the back of his pickup truck bed. So much better than the float tube he used to use. This keeps him dry, has room for a little ice chest and with his electric trolling motor he can fish all day and not get tired. Well made and has lots of little extra places to put things a fisherman needs.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Better not weigh more than 150#
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 204 and the pontoons buckle under my weight. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Mark Priest

customer_reviews.title: Happy Wife, Happy Life!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husbands birthday, and he was absolutely blown away! He could not Love this boat anymore than he does! I am now a pontoon widow, which is Ok, because he is a Happy fisherman 1,000%!!! Thank You Classic Accessories!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Takes to much work to get on the water.
customer_reviews.text: Takes to long to get in the water.Bought a Kayak on the water in minutes. OK if you use a pickup bed.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Eschker

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Stay the heck out of High Sierra cold water.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard L. Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little fishing boat
customer_reviews.text: The boat is easy to assemble once you get started. I do have to say that it's a little intimidating when the box arrives and you open it. The boat floats and travels very well across the water. This boat makes fishing much more fun than just standing on the bank, watching the floaters with envy. The only thing about this boat is it's nice to have someone with their own to help you move it down to the water and talk with while on the lake or river. Great price and buy!
customer_reviews.author: Edward P.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Best boat I've ever had, quality is outstanding and my butt doesn't get wet when I get in the water, can stand on this boat safely and never feel worried at all, even going over good sized waterfalls, wouod definitely recommend to anyone, my 12 yr old brother loves this boat as well, easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great boat
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome. Buy an air pump with good pressure to offset the valve. Otherwise u have to offset it manually and u loose air when u disconnect the pump. Bought 2 pumps, one electric and one hand and neither of them worked. Boat is easy to assemble and of sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: T J

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but you will need to modify it a little to get it comfortable. Plenty of YouTube videos show you how to rig it up.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice boat but must drill holes for the seat
customer_reviews.text: I got my boat today looks great but one thing there no holes for the seat so now I need to drill some holes in the frame for the seat.but all in all looks great can't wait to go fishing
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy watercraft. Can't wait to get it in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this boat in the water 2 times now and the pontoon will not stay up and cant get a nswer from them 4 months old now
customer_reviews.author: Scruggsie101

customer_reviews.title: Wish it came with or their was a cart for easy mobility.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. Big and bulky to move by yourself but is manageable. Wish it came with or their was a cart for easy mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa Willis

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for a stable, maneuverable platform for fishing ... this is it!
customer_reviews.text: Some friends and I purchased 5 of these boats. They have performed wonderfully! We’ve used them for floating and fishing rivers and lakes. These pontoon boats are extremely stable and very easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Bret Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Deflate a little after use buy hand pump and top off when using
customer_reviews.text: Love this pontoon most comfortable boat to five out of. Recommend getting swivel seat and extension for electric motor
customer_reviews.author: dave pascarella

customer_reviews.title: Unable to use due leak, canot find. Customer Service useless
customer_reviews.text: Don't wast your money. Cannot use it just sits in my garage. Had a leak since I received it, tried to get help from customer service.....USELESS. Cannot return. BIG FAT WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY
customer_reviews.author: T. Laberteaux

customer_reviews.title: Great boat
customer_reviews.text: Great little float boat. A little heavy for one guy to move around but I use it in a pond at the house. Very comfortable and stable to fish out of.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Fit and finish ?
customer_reviews.text: During setup....noticed some bad stitching....couple cuts in side of boat only in one pontoon. Quality control missed. I hope it does not effect my boat.
customer_reviews.author: Keven Ormiston

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this boat 2 times and the stitching is coming apart in multiple locations and the metal frame has began to rustin the Inside diameter of all the pipes. Not sure how of if I can return this item but I wouldnt recomend it to any one..
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: Impressive pontoon boat.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome pontoon for the price. It comes well equipped for fishing, floating, and handling mild rapids.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the independent fisherman/woman
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Have had it 2 years now, no real complaints. I transport the frame assembled on top of my Subaru Forester with canoe/kayak blocks attached to the bottom, and blow up the toons onsite with a rechargeable Coleman pump and top off with a hand pump. I did add more rod holders to the back cargo cage, but I don’t use a motor. Actually had a fish get stuck (by the hook) on a toon this last trip, no leak!! I thought for sure I’d be sinking on the way to the dock. Primarily used for fishing smaller inland lakes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Gerhardt

customer_reviews.title: very good deal for a decent amount of money.
customer_reviews.text: great boat for my needs. sits high,rides great,easy to get around. like the adjustable seat rails. have not tried it with a trolling motor as of yet but fully intend to. great overall pontoon boat for the money. very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert w. Meeker jr.

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: Great little pontoon boat with awesome maneuverability. Little tricky to put together for the first time but should get easier to next time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PRICE
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great until the day after I received mine... you dropped the price by over 100 dollars. Come on man! That just isn't cool!
customer_reviews.author: J2theD

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it. I now own 3 of them. Have owned 2 for 5 years or more. The best out there.
customer_reviews.author: richard hazelwood

customer_reviews.title: Classic Accessories 69660 Colorado Boat
customer_reviews.text: Very cool boat. I installed a 7" lift on the seat and it puts you a little higher in the water. I cant wait to get an electric motor but the 7' paddles work good to for those lakes that dont allow motors. The wheel under the seat made it easy to manuver the boat around on land by myself. With my fishing buddy strapped to the pontoon, I'm set. The price beat everybody by a mile. Thanks!!!
customer_reviews.author: sixteyfour

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Faithful
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, went together real easy, good material. Haven’t used it yet. My beef is 2 days after I purchased item it went down from $430ish something to $330 something.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Not a unit that is portable for a long hike if you have bad knees or hips
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It is a go anywhere pontoon. It is heavy, so I would suggest putting in where a hike is not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Good boat
customer_reviews.text: I am 250lbs and about 6'2". I can ride in this thing so comfortably. I am very glad I made this purchase. I've floated rivers with class 1&2 rapids and camped out of it and used in lakes. I like this boat very much and will be using it a lot more in the future. I do not use a trolling motor. If you can row well then this boat glides well. I have no problem rowing upstream or against a small current.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Hendo

customer_reviews.title: Get that special battery case for the trolling motor battery it works great
customer_reviews.text: Been bass fishing all Summer with It getting ready for trout season Great investment I’m very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service from Colorado Accessories
customer_reviews.text: I have several pontoon boats and needed to replace an older one. Very happy with this one. Had a problem with one of the pontoons due to damage in shipping. I called Classic Accessories and they replaced it right away with no problem. I would purchase from this company again!!
customer_reviews.author: cathy hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: Don't know yet
customer_reviews.text: Don't know about the perfomance yet but I went too tayor on I put a 86ld thrust trolling motor 24v...... 2 group 27 batterys. I'll give u an update later
customer_reviews.author: Roy R.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this platoon bought this a little bit ago for the Summer started I upgraded it with a fishfinder a Kyoto motor 30lb and 360 swivel seat prefect gift for a angler
customer_reviews.author: Jhudg3nsBjj

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Really a great deal. A very solid rig, and can expanded on to, with the troller mount. I’ve already worked out a way to put a bimini on it. I love my little pontoon
customer_reviews.author: David Person III

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boat!
customer_reviews.text: Boat was as advertised. Easy to put together I will be putting it in the water in a few weeks will let you know how it goes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pontoon boat
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a very well made product. It went together easily and for the price surprised me by it’s quality. Exceeded my expectations for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Best nonessential purchase I’ve made in several years expecting many enjoyable outings from California to Oklahoma and Texas
customer_reviews.author: W J Fields

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AS advertized, works well, not as high as some due to the diameter of the pontoons.
customer_reviews.author: M.L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with travel wheel
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Have owned for several years now with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Will Dunker

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Just doesn't work. Deflates quickly and if you use a trolling motor the entire back of the boat sinks.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great fun boat and worth the money well made not ...
customer_reviews.text: Great fun boat and worth the money well made not high end but not low end at all a good boat all the same and priced well
customer_reviews.author: Greg Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this rig I had to replace one ...
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this rig I had to replace one of the o-ring seals because it was damaged but other than that it's awesome
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: got a great price on this because the box was damaged but I would pay full price love it
customer_reviews.author: chris moschetti

customer_reviews.title: this little boat is awesome I just have to get use to the oars
customer_reviews.text: this little boat is awesome I just have to get use to the oars
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: stable
customer_reviews.text: all it needs is a canopy accessory so you can stay out longer. easy paddle forwards and backwards and very stable
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: ... a river in my area and I am extremely happy w/ the way it handles and manuves in a ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a river in my area and I am extremely happy w/ the way it handles and manuves in a slow currant. I had no problen launching or removing from the stream . Its light weight and balance are combined to make this an exceptinal piece of equiptment. I'm 68 rs. old w/ a very bad back and I thought my time on the rivers and lakes was over , however this
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for fishing small lakes.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. It is easy to control where you're going and it will turn on a dime. It floats you high above the water. It is tricky to go in a straight line.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool
customer_reviews.text: This is really cool especially with a electric motor on it. The only thing is I didn't realize I have to pay every time I go on the water with it here in California.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just the right size, Can put a trolling motor on it and cruse around a lake No problem. Remove and down the river you go. Easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great river raft
customer_reviews.text: Raft is perfect for my intended use , I’ve used it 4 times with absolutely no issues. Great price and product
customer_reviews.author: guy austin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this boat. Dollars to quality cannot be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jay W

customer_reviews.title: Colorado Pontoon Boat
customer_reviews.text: When the boat arrived I was pleasantly surprised at how well it had been packed and how well it was made. I took it out on the Klammath River last weekend for it's maiden voyage and it performed better than I had expected. The seat is very comfortable, it's easy to row and once deflated, fits neatly into the back of my car. I would recommend this boat to anyone looking for a top quality pontoon boat at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great pontoon for the money
customer_reviews.text: We have used it several times already and we love it. There are pockets everywhere. The cage on the back hold our battery just fine. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: mwillden

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boat haven’t seen the water yet will update when weather gets better
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Kane

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product everything perfect. You will want longer anchor rope.
customer_reviews.author: rich r

customer_reviews.title: Owned several, the BEST so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several pontoons and this model is by far the best yet. Big and stable, and long enough pontoons to stay stable in chop. Everything is well made, and this boat will certainly give me years of great fishing. Simple set up with and electric pump and manual pump to finish off. A bit heavy to carry at 70 lb, but honestly it is worth the effort. Handles a trolling motor and has plenty of weight capacity and storage to bring more than enough gear, equipment and the like. Would like to see a second rod holder...but it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: tony.chad.6

customer_reviews.title: Pontoon Fishing Boat
customer_reviews.text: This boat has very good storage and more than most boats, boat is great for small lakes or reservoirs. Good boat at this price.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Kluesner

customer_reviews.title: Floating Fun
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic boat! I bought the smaller red classic earlier and enjoyed it so much, but alone. So I upgraded a bit and bought this larger one for myself and gave my wife the first. Both boats are so much better built than the competions in the bigger sporting goods stores that I am totally pleased with the craftsmanship and know we will get many happy fishing seasons from them. This Colorado is setup for a motor, so that will be the next addition. I hardily recommend this one for the larger guy. I'm six one and 240 and this boat fits me comfortably. My advice, BUY IT!
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Sorry but there are issues.
customer_reviews.text: My issue for not giving a higher rating is the valve design for the bladders are very difficult work operate. You will loose a lot of air out when trying to get the closed, hence a soft bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Tom studer

customer_reviews.title: Colorado Boat
customer_reviews.text: As a senior, I had difficulty staying bent over for the long periods required to do all the strapping. I also felt the strap ends could have allowed more room at the buckles in order to slip the straps through. Once assembled, it was fun on the water. Very stable, though your feet will almost always be dragging in the water. You will not need a trolling motor with more thrust than 30. Steering the boat with the motor was really hard. It would have been better to have the motor in the front pulling the boat rather than pushing it. Frankly, after a few uses, I sold the boat - again because of my age and restricted abilities.
customer_reviews.author: J.T.P. Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: Love!!! We are anxious to get out in the lake with these!! Wider than I anticipated, and seats very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and he absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Linette Bixby

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very Pleased with unit, easy assembly, comfortable to fish from.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Corley

customer_reviews.title: comfortable and ease to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This unit has everything you want as a fisherman, comfortable and ease to assemble, love that the designed was guided toward fisherman. One Down fault I give is the Oars and the position of the oars. It is difficult to get into a pattern and when encounter heavy win it is tough to maneuver. Other than that this unit is superb and I recommend it to us in lakes and ponds where the wakes and win are not rough, if not be ready for a hard upper body workout.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Martinez

customer_reviews.title: awesome deal
customer_reviews.text: fantastic delivery time. well made and easy to assemble. very comfortable and very fair price. awesome deal and i will be a returning customer.
customer_reviews.author: abigail hodges

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Boat is working good. Was delivered ahead of what was expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Williams

product_meta.title: Classic Accessories Colorado Pontoon Boat
product_meta.description:
The Colorado Inflatable Pontoon Boat by Classic Accessories is a 9-foot, high-capacity pontoon boat with a padded seat and huge storage capacity; including over 20 pockets and 2 insulated drink holders. When you buy from Classic Accessories, you’ll receive peace of mind along with your product, thanks to our hassle-free warranty program. If you’re disappointed with your purchase within the warranty period, we invite you to file a simple claim on our website, supported by our US-based team.

AMAZON.COM


Front View Armrest Storage Rear Storage Bronze Oar Locks Durable Seat Rear View COLORADO PONTOON BOAT
 9 FOOT HIGH-CAPACITY PONTOON BOAT WITH PADDED SEAT
 * BOAT SPECIFICATIONS
 *  9 foot pontoons
 *  400 lb capacity
 *  River rating—Class 1
 *  Assembled size: 108"l 56"w 2
 * 6"h Weight: 71.5 lbs
 *  1-year warranty

 * SPECIAL FEATURES
 *  High storage capacity; includes 10 mesh pockets, 12 zippered pockets and two insulated drink holders
 *  Wire rear storage and battery platform
 *  Rod holder can be mounted in three different positions on each oar stand
 *  Anchor system with fillable mesh bag; cleat and pulley controls can fit on right or left side of boat
 *  Sturdy two position motor mount for trolling 
 *  Detachable foam fly patch

 * COMFORT FEATURES
 *  Three oar-lock positions
 *  Seat and footrests adjust to a wide range of leg lengths
 *  Padded fold-down plastic seat

 * CONSTRUCTION FEATURES
 *  Heavy-duty pontoons with abrasion-resistant PVC bottoms and tough nylon tops
 *  Bronze oar-locks
 *  Powder-coated steel tube frame
 *  Rugged 7 foot two-piece aluminum oars
 *  Cold and heat-resistant bladders
 *  Combination quick inflation/deflation valves

 * SAFETY FEATURES
 *  Safety labeling as per ABYC standards
 *  Rides high for improved visibility
 *  Unique dual-side stripping apron with fish ruler allows entry and exit without unclipping
 *  Non-slip footrests

h4>Colorado Pontoon Boat The Colorado inflatable personal pontoon fishing boat offers huge storage capacity; includes over 20 pockets and 2 insulated drink holders. Weatherproof motor mount. Wire rear storage and battery platform. Fishing rod holder can be mounted in 6 different positions. Integrated anchor system with fillable mesh bag, cord and pulley can be mounted from either side or back. Detachable foam fly patch. Padded plastic seat for extra comfort. 3 oar-lock positions. Seat mount and foot rests adjust to any leg length. Unique dual-side stripping apron with fish ruler allows entry and exit of pontoon boat without un-clipping. Rides high for improved visibility. Combination fill/quick deflation valves. Tow rings. Non-slip foot rests. No tools needed for assembly. Brass oar locks. Heavy-duty pontoons with abrasion-resistant PVC bottoms and tough nylon tops. Powder coated steel tube frame. 7' two-piece aluminum oars. Cold and heat resistant bladders. 9' pontoons. 400 lb. capacity. River rating-Class I. Assembled weight 69 lbs. Assembled size is 108" long x 56" wide x 30" high (to top of seat). 1-year warranty.
